H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H1627.def: = the passage which leads from the back of the mouth of humans in the direction of the lungs; ► internally, it functions as a passageway for food and breath; externally, it is a place around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ associated with food and speaking

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H7782.def: = a musical instrument ◄ made from a ram's horn; ► sound is produced by blowing into the small end; ► used for giving signals and during festivals and celebrations

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H6684.def: = action by which someone abstains from eating food, sometimes accompanied by mourning, prayer, and sacrifices, ◄ as a result of grief, repentance, or done as part of a ritual; ► its primary intention is to humble oneself before God and so be pleasing to him

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6031.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H4683.def: = thin cracker-like bread made without yeast

H7562.def: = action by which humans or deities act in a way that is contrary to (God's) law, ► resulting in a state of guilt

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H6031.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3721.def: = state in which the head or upper body of humans is bent forward, ◄ often as a sign of grief, humiliation, and suffering

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H100.def: = plant with flexible stems, growing in rivers and marshes; ◄ |iScirpus|i*; ► produces much smoke when burning and used for making ropes; ≈ associated with humility

H3331.def: = causative action by which humans spread out a cloth on the floor or a bed with the intention of sleeping on top of it

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H665.def: = powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H7522.def: = state in which deities or humans in a position of authority are favorable disposed towards a person or activity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H2784.def: literally: cords used to bind people so that they cannot freely move about; hence: = things that affect the life of a person and from which that person cannot easily free him/herself

H7562.def: = action by which humans or deities act in a way that is contrary to (God's) law, ► resulting in a state of guilt

H92.def: = cord ► used to fasten one object to another

H7533.def: = causative action by which humans destroy an object by using force to break it into two or more pieces

H2670.def: = state of not being under the control of someone else

12.gl: "to loose bonds of wickedness" = to release (people) that are kept in bondage unjustly

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H7457.def: = condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H4788.def: literally: restlessness; hence: = state in which humans are experiencing hard times in which it is hard to feel at rest

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H6174.def: = state in which humans are either without clothes or insufficiently dressed; ≈ often associated with poverty or shame

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H7837.def: = the first appearance of light in the sky in the early morning

H724.def: = causative action by which humans restore a building to its original state

H6779.def: = process by which plants, trees, or hairs come up and start growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming in existence of people, conditions, or activities

H4120.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H7768.def: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4133.def: = long wooden pole ► for carrying heavy objects from one location to another

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H676.def: = one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body

H6329.def: = state in which an object stands unsteadily

H2224.def: = process by which the sun appears in the morning to provide light and warmth to the world; ≈ associated with a new period of well-being

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H653.def: = state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and lack of wisdom

H1588.def: = a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as a burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance

H4161.def: = action by which humans, deities, plants, or objects leave or emerge from a certain place or position

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3576.def: = action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H4144.def: = the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it; sometimes used in a somewhat figurative sense to denote the foundations of heaven and earth

H2723.def: = state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H1443.def: = causative action by which someone builds or repairs a wall, often made of natural stones; ≈ such a wall is sometimes used to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

H6556.def: = large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7676.def: = the seventh day of the week, which is a day of rest during which the people are not to do any work

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
